An organized list of repeat families that provides tools to fit the list to the screen.

0.1

RepeatFamilyList

public RepeatFamilyList(ChromosomeManager chromosomeManager,
                        ChromosomeListOfLists<java.lang.Integer> startList,
                        ChromosomeListOfLists<java.lang.Integer> stopList,
                        ChromosomeListOfLists<java.lang.String> familyNameList)
                 throws ManagerDataNotLoadedException,
                        InvalidChromosomeException
Creates an instance of RepeatFamilyList Generates an organize list of repeats from the data in parameter

Parameters:
chromosomeManager - a ChromosomeManager
chromosomeList - list of Chromosome
startList - list of start position of the repeats organized by chromosome
stopList - list of stop position of the repeats organized by chromosome
familyNameList - list of name of the repeats organized by chromosome
Throws:
ManagerDataNotLoadedException
InvalidChromosomeException
Method Detail

fitToScreen

protected void fitToScreen()
Adapts the list of the Chromosome in parameter to the screen depending on the xfactor

Specified by:
fitToScreen in class DisplayableListOfLists<RepeatFamily,java.util.List<RepeatFamily>>

findStart

private int findStart(java.util.ArrayList<ChromosomeWindow> list,
                      int value,
                      int indexStart,
                      int indexStop)
Recursive and dichotomic search algorithm.

Parameters:
list - List in which the search is performed.
value - Searched value.
indexStart - Start index where to look for the value.
indexStop - Stop index where to look for the value.
Returns:
The index of a Repeat with a position start equals to value. Index of the first Repeat with a start position superior to value if nothing found.

findStop

private int findStop(java.util.ArrayList<ChromosomeWindow> list,
                     int value,
                     int indexStart,
                     int indexStop)
Recursive and dichotomic search algorithm.

Parameters:
list - List in which the search is performed.
value - Searched value.
indexStart - Start index where to look for the value.
indexStop - Stop index where to look for the value.
Returns:
The index of a Repeat with a position stop equals to value. Index of the first Repeat with a stop position superior to value if nothing found.

start - a start position
stop - a stop position
Returns:
the fitted data between position start and position stop
